channel.title: Requirements
channel.description: What is the requirement to hold a server stable with 10-45 players?24/7 no lag

item.title: Requirements
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:19, topic:351365”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=447724.msg3295904#msg3295904 date=1280941877]

You can host a decient server with low specs. I have a laptop with 1.6GHz CPU, and 512MB of ram. The last server I hosted, i had around 50 people online with no lag. Keep this in mind, a well built server can hold many more people easy on that kind of specs. Nobody on MSCP has the knowledge to build one good enough.

ry60003333 managed to get 2000 on his server at once, twice, with 512mb RAM.
[/quote]
Until i see 2k REAL people on his server, i don’t trust it.[/quote]
Bots, like players, send packets. Just treat bots as players who log in but are away.

OP: It depends on the networking of your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Requirements
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:19, topic:351365”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=447724.msg3295904#msg3295904 date=1280941877]

You can host a decient server with low specs. I have a laptop with 1.6GHz CPU, and 512MB of ram. The last server I hosted, i had around 50 people online with no lag. Keep this in mind, a well built server can hold many more people easy on that kind of specs. Nobody on MSCP has the knowledge to build one good enough.

ry60003333 managed to get 2000 on his server at once, twice, with 512mb RAM.
[/quote]
Until i see 2k REAL people on his server, i don’t trust it.[/quote]

The bots and actual players are basically the same thing. The thing that puts the most stress on the server, is player updating - the bots act as real players and undergo updating as if they were real. Ry provided a video of him filling his server with 2000 bots that moved and spammed text (This was most likely to put more stress on the player updating block), that is what the majority of people on any normal servers do; walk and talk.

I know that each player does other activities other than walk and talk, however those things won’t cause much extra of a delay in each server cycle, therefore the bots (That Ry used) are pretty much a legit test on how many players his server can hold.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:

[quote=“hawkgames, post:10, topic:351365”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=447724.msg3285883#msg3285883 date=1280195764]
Um, a well programed server can hold that many people with barely any resources.
[/quote]what u mean?btw im using rune-zone source

edit:11-25[/quote]

Like one that uses event handlers and such. That doesn’t run on a million threads.

item.title: Requirements
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Eh, my system is a single-core 2.2GHz with 4GB of RAM + 2GB if I use an SD card, but whenever someone tried to join, I always get [SYSTEM IS TOO SLOW TO HOST SERVER] or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Requirements
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:351365”][quote author=hawkgames link=topic=447724.msg3285880#msg3285880 date=1280195663]
my memory ram is 1024mb
[/quote]

That would be 1.024GB. Now it all depends how many operations/processes are going on your computer.

Do Ctrl + Alt + Delete, look in process, and go to “processes” see how much CPU usage you have going.

It all depends on the computer, programs, and server base.[/quote]
1042mb is not 1.024gb. 1024mb is 1gb.

you want a decent computer if your going to host a successful server. at least a duel core, 2-4gb of ram, and at least a 50+gb HDD.

Read full topic

item.title: Requirements
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:351365”][quote author=hawkgames link=topic=447724.msg3285880#msg3285880 date=1280195663]
my memory ram is 1024mb
[/quote]

That would be 1.024GB. Now it all depends how many operations/processes are going on your computer.[/quote]
No, that would be 1Gb

@Topic
1Gb of RAM with windows isn’t that much, but RAM isn’t the only thing you have to worry about. If you want to have a good number of players on, you also need a good network line(100+Mbps).

Read full topic
